content: leonie pairs classic tweed yarn and timeless style with graceful lace in this lovely vest equally easy to layer over dresses and buttondowns leonie will add a sophisticated flourish to a wide range of outfits leonie is knit from the bottom up with hems worked separately before joining to work in the round to the underarms the back and front are completed separately and seamed at the shoulders neckband and armhole bands are picked up and worked in the round during finishing *lace pattern is both charted and written out * **sizes** 1 2 3 5 5 6 7 **finished measurements** bust 36 42 48 54 60 66 72 / 91 5 106 5 122 137 152 5 167 5 183 cm back length front is 1 / 2 5 cm shorter 17½ 18 18 18½ 18½ 19 19 / 44 5 45 5 45 5 47 47 48 5 48 5 cm shown in size 2 recommended ease approximately 2-4 / 5-10 cm positive ease **yarn** berroco millstone tweed 50 g 4 5 5 6 6 7 8 balls #11108 anchor **needles** 32 / 80 cm circular needles sizes 7 / 4 5 mm and 9 / 5 5 mm *or size to obtain gauge* 16 / 40 cm circular needle size 7 / 4 5 mm **notions** removeable stitch markers stitch markers tapestry needle waste yarn to hold stitches **gauge** 16 sts and 21 row = 4 / 10 cm in pattern st on larger needles *gauge is measured after blocking to save time and ensure accurate measurements take time to check gauge *
